abstract: Syrian refugees living in camps just outside border of their own country are settling into situation that is starting to feel permanent;  rough, city-like infrastructures have sprung up in camps in Turkey, Lebanon and Jordan, where vast majority of refugees remain even as ever-increasing numbers of migrants flood Europe.
lead_paragraph: While the West grapples with thousands of Syrians, millions more have settled into lives with limited opportunities in Jordan, Turkey and Lebanon.

headline.main: As Others Flee to West, Most Syrian Refugees Remain in Region
headline.print_headline: Syrian Refugees Settle Into Lives Far From West

snippet: While the West grapples with thousands of Syrians, millions more have settled into lives with limited opportunities in Jordan, Turkey and Lebanon.
